method.name: Contrast estimation

reference.ref: J. Zar, Biostatistical Analysis, Prentice Hall, Upper Saddle River, New Jersey, 1999.
D. Sheskin, Handbook of parametric and nonparametric statistical procedures. Chapman and Hall/CRC, 2003.
J. Demsar, Statistical comparisons of classifiers over multiple data sets. Journal of Machine Learning Research 7 (2006) 1-30

generalDescription.objective: Execution of the contrast estimation for comparison of the global performance of several classification methods.
generalDescription.howWork: Using the data resulting from the run of various classifiers over multiple data sets in an experiment, the researcher could be interested in the estimation of the difference between two classifiers performance. A procedure for this purpose assumes that the expected differences between performances of algorithms are the same across data sets. We assume that the performance is reflected by the magnitudes of the differences between the performances of the algorithms. Consequently, we are interested in estimating the contrast between medians of samples of results considering all pairwise comparisons. It obtains a quantitative difference computed through medians between two algorithms over multiple data sets, but the value obtained will change when using other data sets in the experiment.

method.example:
Problem type: Classification Methods to compare: Clas-KNN vs Clas-C45 vs Clas-Fuzzy-Chi Datasets: cleveland, glass, iris, monks-2, pima Default Parameters (all the post-hoc tests are applied) Type of partitions: k-fold, k=10
After the execution of RunKeel.jar we can see into the ./results/Stat-Clas-Contrast/TSTClas-KNNvsClas-C45vsClas-Fuzzy-Chi folder the results0s0.stat file:
------------------------------------------------------------ Contrast Test, Classification Classification error in each foldfold: Algorithm = Clas-KNN Fold 0 : 0.4666666666666667 Fold 1 : 0.5666666666666667 Fold 2 : 0.4 Fold 3 : 0.4666666666666667 Fold 4 : 0.3333333333333333 Fold 5 : 0.5666666666666667 Fold 6 : 0.3870967741935484 Fold 7 : 0.5483870967741935 Fold 8 : 0.4666666666666667 Fold 9 : 0.4838709677419355 Mean Value: 0.4686021505376344 Algorithm = Clas-C45 Fold 0 : 0.4 Fold 1 : 0.5333333333333333 Fold 2 : 0.36666666666666664 Fold 3 : 0.5 Fold 4 : 0.4666666666666667 Fold 5 : 0.4666666666666667 Fold 6 : 0.45161290322580644 Fold 7 : 0.41935483870967744 Fold 8 : 0.5333333333333333 Fold 9 : 0.41935483870967744 Mean Value: 0.4556989247311828 Algorithm = Clas-Fuzzy-Chi Fold 0 : 0.4 Fold 1 : 0.4 Fold 2 : 0.4666666666666667 Fold 3 : 0.36666666666666664 Fold 4 : 0.36666666666666664 Fold 5 : 0.5 Fold 6 : 0.5161290322580645 Fold 7 : 0.4838709677419355 Fold 8 : 0.4 Fold 9 : 0.45161290322580644 Mean Value: 0.43516129032258066 --------------------------------------------------------------
and a LaTeX output file "output.tex" where the results of the application of the test are provided.
